Name: content.changepassword.passwordConfirmAlert
Value: The confirmation password must be the same as the new password.\n

Name: content.controlSigns.fourWayStopDescription
Value: When approaching the 4 way stop sign, stop as you would at a normal stop sign, if there are more than 2 vehicles at the intersection vehicles move off in the same sequence as they arrived.

Name: content.controlSigns.instructions
Value: Hover the pointer over the image to get the name and description

Name: content.controlSigns.noEntryDescription
Value: When you see this sign dont go down the road which it is on else the cops will have to cuff you.

Name: content.controlSigns.oneWayLeftDescription
Value: The one way roadway sign R4.1 imposes a mandatory requirement on drivers that, if they intend to use the roadway concerned, then they shall only proceed in such roadway in the direction indicated by the arrow.

Name: content.controlSigns.oneWayRightDescription
Value: The one way roadway sign R4.2 imposes a mandatory requirement on drivers that, if they intend to use the roadway concerned, then they shall only proceed in such roadway in the direction indicated by the arrow.

Name: content.controlSigns.oneWayUpDescription
Value: The one way roadway sign R4.3 imposes a mandatory requirement on drivers that, if they intend to use the roadway concerned, then they shall only proceed in such roadway in the direction indicated by the arrow.

Name: content.controlSigns.pedestrianPriorityDescription
Value: This sign is to indicate to drivers of vehicles that only pedestrians shall be permitted in an area set aside as a pedestrian precinct marked by such signs and the contemplated vehicles such as loading goods.

Name: content.controlSigns.stopDescription
Value: When you approach this sign bring your vehicle to a complete halt, with the front of the car either in line with the stop sign or just before the white line, proceed only when it is safe to do so.

Name: content.controlSigns.stopGoDescription
Value: If the Stop sign is show do not stop as you would at a normal stop sign, but do not proceed until the Go sign is show

Name: content.controlSigns.stopYieldDescription
Value: A mandatory requirement that the driver of a vehicle wishing to proceed straight-on or to the right at the junction ahead, shall act as for stop sign, shall yield right of way to all traffic, from the right , on the roadway which is joined by the roadway on which the driver is travelling where such traffic is so close as to constitute a danger.

Name: content.controlSigns.threeWayStopDescription
Value: When approaching the 3 way stop sign, stop as you would at a normal stop sign, if there are more than 2 vehicles at the intersection vehicles move off in the same sequence as they arrived.

Name: content.controlSigns.yieldAtMiniCircleDescription
Value: This imposes a mandatory requirement that drivers of vehicles approaching a mini circle shall yield right of way to any vehicle which will cross any yield-line at such junction before them.

Name: content.controlSigns.yieldDescription
Value: When you approach this sign decrease your speed and give way to the traffic on 	the road you are entering. Yield before the dotted line and only enter the road when it is safe to do so.

Name: content.controlSigns.yieldToOncomingTrafficDescription
Value: Tihs sign imposes a mandatory requirement that the driver approaching such a sign shall yield to all oncoming traffic, or reqire them to stop and proceed when it is safe to do so.

Name: content.controlSigns.yieldToPedestriansDescription
Value: The yield to pedestrians regulatory sign R2.1 imposes a mandatory requirement that the driver of a vehicle approaching such a sign shall yield right-of-way to pedestrians crossing the public road, or waiting to cross the public road.

Value: Check oil, water, brake fluid and fan belts

Name: content.exteriorInspection.checkHandles
Value: Check door and mirror handles are operating correctly

Name: content.exteriorInspection.checkLights
Value: Check all lights for damage and cleanliness

Name: content.exteriorInspection.checkNumberPlate
Value: Check number plate is clean, secure and valid

Name: content.exteriorInspection.checkSpares
Value: Inform the examiner that the jack, spare wheel and spanner are in working order

Name: content.exteriorInspection.checkTyres
Value: Check tyre wear, inflation, valve cap and other damage

Name: content.exteriorInspection.checkUnder
Value: Check under the vehicle for foreign objects

Name: content.exteriorInspection.checkWheels
Value: Check wheels for oil and grease leaks

Name: content.exteriorInspection.checkWindowsClean
Value: Check that all the windows are clean

Name: content.home.details
Value: In this interactive learning kit you will ...

Name: content.home.drivers.message
Value: Start your Drivers, once you are qualified. Altough you will need lessons in an actual car, this section does as much as possible to prepare you, covering pre-trip inspection, as well as the yard test and the road test. Interactive 3-d simulations will help you to visualise the motions of getting your drivers licence. As in Learners, there is a test mode () feature.

Name: content.home.home.message
Value: Home is where you can check your logbook and find out the results of all your tests, and find out what you ned to brush up on before your exams.Also in Home you can find a directory of teachers and resources in your area who you could contact for extra help.

Name: content.home.learners.message
Value: Within Learners you will find everything you need to easily pass your exam. Once you have memorised all the info, you can repeatedly test yourself in any area by checking the test mode () button. You will receive detailed results that will show you exactly what you do and dont know.

Name: content.home.welcome.message2
Value:
, this is the entry page into the K53 Cyber Drive School program.
This program is divided up into 3 main areas : Home, Learners and Drivers.

Name: content.home.checklist.message1
Value: Tick the checkbox if you have completed an item. Some of the checkboxes will be ticked for you by Learn2Drive3D.

Name: content.home.checklist.message2
Value: If you click the icon, more detailed information will appear. Click the icon to hide it again.

Name: content.home.checklist.message3
Value: For some items, there is a link to the page in Learn2Drive3D where you can complete the item. Click the icon to go to this page.

Name: content.home.checklist.readonlyMessage
Value: Learn2Drive3D will detect whether this item is complete or not and tick or untick it for you.

Name: content.logbook.tooltip.goTo
Value: Click to go to this page

Name: content.login.newUserlabel
Value: Press New User button if you are a first time user

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.accelerator
Value: Press the accelerator down to make the vehicle move. If you are in reverse gear you will move backwards, if you are in any of the other gears you will move forwards. The more you press down, the faster you will go. The accelerator must only ever be pressed down with the right foot. The clutch also needs to be engaged (not pressed down) for the car to move forwards.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.brakePedal
Value: This brake is known as the service brake, or foot brake. Press the brake pedal down to slow the vehicle or to stop. The brake pedal must only ever be pressed with your right foot.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.clutchPedal
Value: Press the clutch pedal down when changing gears. The clutch pedal must only ever be pressed with your left foot. When you are not using it, you must rest your left foot on the floor to the left of the clutch, not on the clutch pedal. Automatic vehicles do not have a clutch pedal.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.gearLever
Value: Use the gear lever to select or change gears. Your clutch needs to be in if you are changing gears. Reverse is a gear, and you need to be in reverse if you want to move backwards. You choose gears according to the speed at which you are travelling. When you first move off, you must be in first gear. After that, generally the faster you are going the higher the gear you use. You should use a lower gear when you are going down a hill and you don't want the vehicle to speed up too much, or when you need more power (for example when you are going up a hill). While your car is stationary you should use neutral.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.handbrake
Value: This brake is also known as the handbrake. Pull the parking brake up to keep the vehicle stationary while you are stopped or when you leave the car. Put it down again before you move off. You must only ever use the parking brake after the vehicle has come to a complete standstill, and not while you are still moving. Use the ratchet release (the button on the end of the parking brake) when putting it up or down.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.indicator
Value: The direction indicator stalk switches on the indicator lights on the outside of your car. It could be found on the other side of the steering wheel depending on the make of car. Push the control up or down (in the direction in which you will be turning the steering wheel) to indicate to other drivers that you want to move or turn towards the left or the right. Put the control back to the middle to cancel the signal when you have finished turning (most times the signal will cancel itself). On most cars the controls for switching the headlights on and off and for changing between main beams and dipped beams are also on this stalk.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.rearview
Value: This is the rear-view mirror, or interior mirror. Look in the mirror to check that it is safe behind your vehicle. You should check the rear-view mirror every 5-8 seconds when you are driving, as well as every time before you brake or signal.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.rightmirror
Value: This is the exterior, or side mirror. Most cars have exterior mirrors on both the driver's and passenger's sides. Look in the mirrors to check that it is safe behind your vehicle. You may check these mirrors every 5-8 seconds while you are driving when you check the main rear-view mirror, but you should especially check them when you are changing direction (check the mirror in the direction in which you want to turn). Be aware that there are some areas next to your car that you can't see in these mirrors. These are called blind spots and have to be checked by turning your head and looking back through the windows.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.speedometer
Value: The speedometer shows you how fast you are travelling. Check the speedometer every now and then to ensure that you are within the speed limit. The speedometer also usually shows the mileage, or total distance that the car has travelled.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.steeringWheel
Value: Turn the steering wheel to change direction. When driving, keep both hands on the steering wheel, except when changing gears or giving hand signals. At these times you must always keep at least one hand on the steering wheel, and replace the other one as quickly as you can. If the steering wheel was a clock you would place your left hand at the 10 and your right hand at the 2.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.tempgauge
Value: The gauges give you information about your engine. Most cars have a temperature gauge telling you how hot the engine is, an oil gauge or warning light to tell you when your oil is low, a fuel gauge to tell you how much petrol you have in your car, and a rev counter to tell you how fast your engine is revolving. Most of the gauges have warning sections marked in red to show you when you are beginning to get out of the safe limits. Check the gauges every now and then to ensure that it is safe to drive or if you need to take action.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.infoText.wiper
Value: The wiper stalk controls the windscreen wipers on the front windscreen. It could be found on the other side of the steering wheel depending on the make of car. You should switch your windscreen wipers on when it is raining to keep your windscreen clear and make sure you can see the road ahead. The wipers can also be used to clean the windscreen if you spray water on them first (usually with a button on the wiper stalk). If you use the wipers while the windscreen is dry they can scrape a bit and sometimes spread dust across it which makes it harder to see.

Name: content.motorVehicleControls.instructions
Value: Click on the picture to see what the various controls do, or click on a control's name in the list below to highlight that control.

Name: content.motorVehicleControlsQuiz.instructions
Value: Click on the vehicle control that you are asked to identify. There are 12 questions in the quiz.

Please note that these are general speeds limits, Speed

Name: content.stopping.infoText
Value:
You may not stop in the road unless:
- Instructed to do so by a traffic officer
- Road Sign
- To avoid an accident
- For a cause that is beyond your control

You may

The vehicle being towed must be in control by a licenced driver unless the vehicles wheels are off the ground.
